news.shortDetail: A large feline allegedly seen near the city square last night.
news.fullDetail: Residents claim to have spotted a cat the size of a car walking through downtown. Several blurry images have been shared online. Experts remain skeptical, suggesting it's likely a camera trick.

comments.comment: That’s obviously Photoshopped, look at the shadow!
I live in the area and saw something similar last night.
Perspective trick. Look at the car behind it.
News sites already debunked it.

news.topic: New Tech Can Charge Phones in 10 Seconds
news.shortDetail: Startup claims to have invented ultra-fast phone charger.
news.fullDetail: A small tech startup has announced a charger that can fully charge a smartphone in just 10 seconds. Scientists are divided, some calling it a breakthrough while others demand proof.

comments.comment: I've seen their demo at CES, it’s real tech!
Seems too good to be true. Probably a marketing stunt.
They explained the battery chemistry—makes sense.
Already available for pre-order in Japan.

news.topic: Bananas Now Classified as Luxury Food
news.shortDetail: Due to extreme weather, banana prices have skyrocketed.
news.fullDetail: The Ministry of Agriculture announced that bananas are now officially classified as a luxury food item due to global shortages and rising prices caused by severe storms.

comments.comment: I paid $10 for a single banana yesterday. This is real!
Prices are insane at my local market.
I just bought a bunch for $3. Not everywhere is expensive.
Government reports confirm the classification.

news.topic: Alien Signal Detected from Nearby Star
news.shortDetail: Astronomers claim to have picked up strange radio signals.
news.fullDetail: A group of amateur astronomers reported detecting repeating radio signals from a star 12 light years away. Professional observatories are now attempting to verify the claims.

comments.comment: This exact claim happened in 2016 and was debunked.
Could be true, space is full of mysteries.
Data was misinterpreted—it's a known pulsar.
No official statement from major observatories.

news.shortDetail: New public transport system will use levitating buses.
news.fullDetail: The city council announced a futuristic project featuring magnetically levitated buses running on dedicated tracks to reduce congestion.

comments.comment: Already saw the test run last week!
Sounds like sci-fi to me.
Government budget documents confirm funding.
Maglev tech exists—just applied to buses now.

news.shortDetail: Climate change affecting cocoa bean harvests.
news.fullDetail: Experts warn that reduced cocoa harvests could lead to a global chocolate shortage by the end of the year.

comments.comment: News outlets confirm it. Stock up now!
Already seeing prices go up.
They say this every year.
Cocoa farmers are struggling badly.

news.shortDetail: AI-powered robot cooks and serves customers.
news.fullDetail: A new robotic chef can prepare 50 dishes and serve customers without human assistance, reducing restaurant wait times.

comments.comment: I ate there yesterday—it was awesome.
The robot makes perfect pasta.
Sounds like marketing hype.
BBC covered this story.

news.shortDetail: Residents claim to see a shark in freshwater.
news.fullDetail: Several locals reported seeing a shark swimming in the city river. Wildlife experts suspect it could be a bull shark, which can survive in freshwater.

comments.comment: Probably just a large fish mistaken for a shark.
Bull sharks can live in freshwater—it’s possible.
Local news debunked it with drone footage.
No evidence in official wildlife reports.

news.shortDetail: A bright meteor was seen streaking across the sky.
news.fullDetail: Residents across the city reported witnessing a bright meteor last night. Astronomers confirmed it was a small asteroid burning up in the atmosphere.

comments.comment: I saw it myself—super bright!
Local observatory confirmed it.
Could just be fireworks mistaken for a meteor.

news.shortDetail: Man claims to have grown a 500-pound pumpkin.
news.fullDetail: A gardener says he has cultivated a pumpkin weighing over 500 pounds in his backyard. Neighbors shared pictures online showing the enormous vegetable.

comments.comment: The pictures look convincing.
Looks photoshopped to me.
Pumpkin competitions often have huge ones like this.

news.shortDetail: Unexplained lights appeared above a local lake.
news.fullDetail: Several boaters reported seeing strange glowing lights hovering over Lake Greenwood. Some believe it was drones, while others suggest UFO activity.

comments.comment: Definitely drones, nothing mysterious here.
The lights moved strangely—doesn’t look like drones.
Local police said it was part of a light show.

news.shortDetail: Residents see a four-legged robot delivering parcels.
news.fullDetail: A tech company tested robotic dogs to deliver packages in a suburban neighborhood. Videos show the robots walking up driveways and leaving parcels.

comments.comment: I saw it in action this morning—really cool!
Looks like a viral prank video.
Tech companies are already doing this kind of test.
